Background.text:
AKA hyaline membrane disease, infantile respiratory distress syndrome, respiratory distress syndrome of the newborn, or RDS
Due to surfactant deficiency in infants delivered prematurely
60% chance of developing RDS if delivered <29wks gestation, 10% of preemies overall, rare in full term infants
[1]
Onset rapid upon delivery

Clinical_Features.text:
Grunting, retractions,
hypoxia
, cyanosis, or other signs of
respiratory distress
in a recently delivered premature infant

Differential_Diagnosis.text:
Meconium aspiration syndrome
Transient tachypnea of the newborn
Pneumonia
Sepsis
Congenital heart disease
Persistent
pulmonary hypertension
of the newborn
Pneumothorax
Anatomical malformation (e.g. congenital diaphragmatic hernia)
Anemia
,
polycythemia
Upper airway obstruction

Evaluation.text:
Evaluate for other causes of respiratory distress (e.g.
pneumonia
,
congenital heart disease
, etc.)
CXR
: homogenous opaque infiltrates, air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes
[2]

Management.text:
See
newborn resuscitation
for general management of distressed newborn
Surfactant replacement (e.g. Servanta) given endotracheally
Prevented by prenatal
corticosteroids
between 24-34wks gestation in cases where high risk of preterm delivery
[3]
